gene.function: FUNCTION: Component of chylomicrons, very low-density lipoproteins (VLDL), low-density lipoproteins (LDL), and high-density lipoproteins (HDL) in plasma. Plays an important role in lipoprotein metabolism as an activator of lipoprotein lipase. Both proapolipoprotein C-II and apolipoprotein C-II can activate lipoprotein lipase. In normolipidemic individuals, it is mainly distributed in the HDL, whereas in hypertriglyceridemic individuals, predominantly found in the VLDL and LDL. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:2209608, ECO:0000303|PubMed:22304839}.
geneOntologyBiologicalProcess: negative regulation of lipid metabolic process [GO:0045833]
negative regulation of very-low-density lipoprotein particle clearance [GO:0010916]
positive regulation of fatty acid biosynthetic process [GO:0045723]
positive regulation of lipoprotein lipase activity [GO:0051006]
positive regulation of phospholipid catabolic process [GO:0060697]
positive regulation of triglyceride catabolic process [GO:0010898]
positive regulation of very-low-density lipoprotein particle remodeling [GO:0010902]
